intro: Celtis swartzii, commonly known as the African hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Elm family (Ulmaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by small, round fruits. Celtis swartzii is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife. Its adaptability to various soil types makes it a resilient and widespread species in its native range.
